}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview==
"EWW302-A1-BL-015" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
Despite being advertised as an N600 device, the hardware is capable of AC1200 speeds and the WiFi Certification includes 802.11ac. It is not known at this time whether the device will actually be artificially limited by software.
{{FCC ST|08/01/2019}}
All of the following devices are internally identical: * [[Linksys E5400]] - ''AC1200 Dual-Band WiFi Router'' * [[Linksys E5350]] - ''AC1000 Dual-Band WiFi Router'' * [[Linksys E5300]] - ''AC750 Dual-Band WiFi Router'' * '''Linksys E2500 v4''' - ''N600 Dual-Band WiFi Router''
{{WiFiCert|WFA81720|01/25/2019}}
==Links of Interest== * [https://www.linksys.com/us/support-article?articleNum=316209 ''Getting to know the Linksys E2500 N600 Dual-Band WiFi 4 Router'']
Linksys E2500 v4 appears to be almost identical on hardware level to [[TOTOLINK LR1200]] router. * [https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/totolink/totolink_lr1200 ''Techdata: TOTOLINK LR1200'']
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/linksys/linksys_e2500_v4 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/e5400 |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = ramips |subtarget = mt76x8 |arch = mipsel_24kc |support_started_version = 23.05.0 |current_supported_version = <!-- auto --> |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here
